I've visited the Grotto BK on several occasions and each time I've always been impressed with their food and service. My favorite dishes are the Escovitch Shrimp, Grotto Pasta with Shrimp, and  their Mac + Cheese is 10/10!

I enjoyed my visit to the grotto! My favorite dish was the starfish and bake. They do have bottomless mimosas here which will definitely sneak up on you! You can also purchase hookah here guys! The spot is small but once you go to the back there's more room.
No comment

If you're looking for great decor and even better drinks, look no further! Came in on a Wednesday for happy hour and enjoyed their fruit punch, 2 for 1 during happy hour!! We sat at the bar and were greeted by the owners daughter and then got a chance to chat with the owner as well.  Very down to earth family and service was great! Great set up with their DJ and hookah. The place gets packed very quickly so be sure to grab seats early, they have a variety of menu items as well! We'll be back for hookah!!

The food was okay. I've had better shrimp and grits, the mimosas will get you drunk but the service was REALLY SLOW. It took forever to get our mimosa refills and brunch is only 90 mins so we probably each got 1 refill. We spent $83 each for brunch and it was not worth it. It's $40 for the unlimited mimosas PLUS the price of your meal which is something that should be explained because we all assumed it was $40 per person plus tax & gratuity. Even getting our water pitcher refilled took forever. Getting cups took a long time too. I don't know if it'll be worth it to come back to this place again. There's only seating in their outside area, the inside area is strictly a bar so no tables there. Our server was MIA most of the time we were there,  yet when it was time to pay the bill she hovered over us like we would run out on her.
No comment
No comment

I had such a horrible experience there. The seating is located in an uninstalled extension of the outside. I wore my coat the entire time. Food took 2 hrs to come, plastic plates, no knives, Did I mention I was freezing, those outdoor heating lamps are not pushing out enough heat. No one has any hospitality training, however, the food was good but the overall experience would not allow me to recommend this place...
No comment

Food was amazing ! I had curry goat rice and peas with cabbage  . Also had the shrimp appetizers the Thai sweet chili shrimp and the escovitch shrimp that I would highly recommend! Service was great! I will definitely be coming back! Great experience!
No comment
The food was amazing. I had the Rasta pasta and oxtail delicious. They also have drinks at reasonable price and hookah. I tend to go out by myself and the vibe was just right nothing

Unassuming ... seemed so quiet. I was unsure if they was still open for the night. But i pushed pass my awkwardness  and headed to the back and the backyard was a vibe. The drinks are strong even though i don't see a full bar. The food was definitely made fresh to order and flavorful. I was craving oxtails. I had a decent serving for what i see places serve these days. I asked for my rice to side and ordered mac n cheese. Mac n cheese was good.  It was alot of rice and tasted really good. I'm not sure who created that meme that Jamaicans dont make good rice cause that's a damn lie. My sister got the jerk nachos which also came out fresh to order and tasted very good. I have been in the cut lately due to covida and glad i got to  experience a new spot

The wings &  mac & cheese was amazing but the service was TERRIBLE. Was going to order an actual entrée but the appetizers took so long that we didn't even want to order any more food from there. It isnt the servers fault since she was covering a bunch of tables but as the customer it isn't fair to pay an automatic 20% tip when the server was not attentive nor did she offer water or utensils for our table we had to keep requesting for something as simple as napkins. But they included tip automatically even tho it was just a party of 3. So yea might just order take out from here but never dining in. The ambiance was okay everyone was frustrated on how long the food was taking. A customer was saying how he waited over an hour for 5 wings :/
No comment
No comment

I went to Grotto with a few of my friends for brunch and I'll start by saying I left full and we all left drunk. My chicken and waffles was good and so was my boyfriend's French toast. Now on to the not so stellar things. 1. The shrimp and grits was literally soup 2. There is only outdoor seating, inside is only a bar no tables. 3. They advertise 90 minutes of bottomless mimosas for $40 on the brunch menu but fail to mention that the $40 does NOT include food. 4. The service was super slow. In the 90 minutes I only got two mimosa refills because the waitress kept disappearing. But when it was time for us to pay she made sure to HOVER over us. Also they serve Caribbean food but had American hot sauce (Tabasco) which I found strange. All and all I would not go back.

The food is absolutely AMAZING!!! The is the perfect spot close to home! Always great vibes and friendly staff! The Mac & cheese is my absolute favorite! Everything on the menu is excellent! Brunch on Sundays are a hit! Love here and it's walking distance

I love The Grotto BK!  Listen! It's like having your parents busting it down in the kitchen! The food better than  good, it is AMAZING! Authentic Jamaican food at it's best!  The staff is helpful and pleasant and make you feel at home.

Met up with my new friend here after work. First off the place is small there was only 2 tables in the front and they only seat 2 ppl per table. Next, they took forever and a day to come and take our order we sat at the table for at least 30 minutes before our order was taken. Nowwwww the wait for our food was longer than the wait for them to take our order and to make it worse they only brought out my friend food and I had to wait another 20 minutes to get mines. Lastly the drinks were pretty good  my we had the coconut Caribbean drink really good, I notice it was a popular drink because the little ppl they had in there had the drink. Moving on to the food my friend had Buffalo wings and fries she said it was good, I had Oxtails, white rice, cabbage and sweet plantains the oxtails was pretty tuff  they didn't fall off the bone I had to fight to get the meat off the bone however the gravy and everything else was good they even give you gravy on the side for your rice. And, lastly the music was good...
Tomatoes, Tomatoes... waited over an hour for food that never came. When I finally asked the waiter how much longer do we have to wait for our food, they said they're getting started on it now.
Place is neat! friendly staff. They offer brunch Saturday and sundays! A must try Pork Skewers and their new item Pork sisig!

This is a really great little restaurant to get inexpensive dishes. I really enjoyed the vegan adobo, especially after putting some chili sauce on it. The coffee was good and woke me right up. The service was really nice and attentive. You can get plenty full and spend less than $20.

Good eats and reasonable price. We got the shrimp shumai, the chicken wings, and the bbq pork w/ the macaroni salad. All were pretty good. I personally really enjoyed the wings, though I did add a little spice to them.

Food was delicious and fresh. Fries could have been warmer. Prices are higher than I expected. Great customer service. A great addition to the neighborhood..
Super tasty and authentic Filipino food here. The service is quick and all the food is great - I'd definitely recommend the lumpia and the pork siopao!
I love this place, the food, and the people working in it. Our favorites include the ube sliders, pork bbq, and ube pao.
The best shumai & the ube Pao. I will come again.  Customer service is very good. No picture of the shumai cos we ate it all
The staff is great--they welcomed me and made great suggestions. The food is unique and really tasty. Their Sunday brunch includes Beef Tapa which is very flavorful.

Most tend to be dry, or overly oily, to the point where they become almost inedible. They were cooked perfectly here, and the filipino style sauce was delicious. Also enjoyed the veggie lumpia and ube pao for dessert. Loved the fast casual atmosphere and welcome, and staff. We'll be back!
No comment

Cantina 33 is solid in my book. The place is small, clean, and colorful. The staff is friendly, and the service is fast. We always go off-peak. We have been more than a handful of times and never leave disappointed. My kid loves the chicken sandwich, and my sister-in-law and I love the margaritas. . Like others have mentioned, they include the tip, and I don't mind. I am sure they have their reasons for that. If I lived close, I'd be on the HH wave bi-weekly. I highly recommend anyone who loves margaritas to check out this place. I have had the salad and some other dishes, and they were good, but the main focus is always on the margaritas, and they always hit!
No comment

I came to this spot with my friends for a boozy brunch afternoon. The service was very slow (there were only 3 parties in the entire restaurant.) We waited close to an hour for our food, when receiving the food it was cold. And I asked for scrambled eggs but did not get scrambled eggs. There is not a lot of options for the bottomless brunch also. A very sad disappointment.

Cute little place in ridgewood. Enough seating and space so you can have an intimate dinner. We tried the ceviche mixto- choclo was still frozen but leche Tigre and seafood tasted good. Not fishy. More on the garlicky side. Entrees were awesome. Wished the lomo saltado came with yuca fries instead as potatoes were just boring American potatoes. For dessert I would not recommend the churros as they were just over powdered with sugar.
No comment

Cute spot with perfect drinks and great service! Chicken skewers, guac, plantains and chaufa made to perfection with 90s R&B playing in the background. Staff very knowledgeable on drinks and recommendations from the menu. I'll def be going back!
No comment
No comment
Cute Peruvian place in town. They have a range of Peruvian options. My favorite was the ceviche
No comment

What a great find! Sat at the bar with Jules and enjoyed a delicious Watermelon smash that was delicious and refreshing.  The ceviche was on point, the arepitas appetizer was very flavorful and the Lomo salteado was mouth watering good. Definitely have to return to enjoy more of the food..its very nice ambiance decorated great for pics and the life is beautiful sign is my favorite.
No comment
No comment

Unfortunately I can't give 0 Stars. Yesterday I had a the worst experience with customer service.  The waitress was very rude.  I have never been made to feel so bad. Since we arrived the waitress was very apathetic and indifferent, however we ordered 1 lomo Saltado, 2 Tacu Tacu, 1 order of Papas a la Huncaina also 1 order of fries and 3 Frozen Margaritas.  We spent almost $200, She brought us the check after 45 minutes, telling us that this was the time limit to be in the restaurant.  She practically ran us off saying that they needed the table, the saddest thing is that the restaurant was empty, there were only 2 occupied tables counting mine.  We hadn't even finished eating, and we thought we'd order something extra btw the tip was already included in the check (18%) for a terrible service.  This is the last time I'm coming and I don't recommend anyone to come, it's just not worth it because they include the tip on your check and not satisfied with that, they suggest you give more tips.  It's a theft!  The worst thing is that the waiters do not even deserve what they ask for since they give Horrible customer service  I NEVER COME BACK AGAIN!
Food was great but small portions. Drinks were great! Music was a little loud. Interior was nice, and clean.
No comment

I was taken back by how small this place actually is. Tiktok and ig make it seem huge - it's tiny. But that is NOT IMPORTANT the food is amazing. Amazing amazing I can not wait to go back. I will get the rum drinks instead bc the tequila was a little strong for my partner and I but thats honestly the only complaint. The staff was pleasant (if overwhelmed) & nice. Service was pretty fast. Tip is included in the price. Will be returning ASAP.
Liked this place nice atmosphere, nice drinks and bar. I recommend. Nice place to chill with friends. Its cozy colorful. Latin music fresh food very clean, good service.

Food is fresh and delicious, Peruvian with a splash of fusion. Drinks are delicious and strong. I always for the Moscow mule or the frozen sangria-margarita mix. Happy hour prices aren't really happy lol (if you know what I mean). The prices are a high for a local venue.

I had been craving Lomo Saltado. Lost my go-to spot during COVID so decided to give this place a chance. The LS was tasty indeed but didnt come with the Verde sauce it typically does. That was disappointing. The Rotisserie chicken was VERY dry. You could see the dryness before even eating it. Packed well for takeout. Cocktails were good particularly the Cucumber Jalapeño Margarita. The Tres leches was just okay. Probably wouldn't order from here again, at least not for take out. Maybe the chicken will be moist in house.

The place is small but the food, drinks and music were amazing. The overall atmosphere was good. It was 4 of us and the wait was about 45 to an hour on a Friday night after 9. We started at the bar and everything from the bar was put on our bill for the table which I loved since we had to wait to be seated anyways. Will go back but maybe a little earlier.

Great food and love that they are pro-freedom! This was the whole reason we went to this place. We would definitely go back again. The only thing I was not sure about was that the server added gratuity to our bill for a party of 3. Had she not done that I would have tipped a lot more. There was not option to add a tip because I wasn't given the option. I am a very generous tipper being a business owner and having worked many years in hospitality in NYC. When I looked at the receipt I could see at the bottom it has "suggested percentages", but again I was not given the option. I also didn't notice anything on the menu that states they do auto gratuity. That was why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars. Otherwise I would definitely give 5.

I want to start with saying the service was great, the young lady was very helpful and attentive. It was pretty busy on a Sunday and she was there managing the whole place alone -.- ! I give her credit . Unfortunately I'm really disappointed but the food was extremely salty!  I didn't even eat it. We order LOMO SALTIADO + CHICKEN CHAUFA + WONTON the lomo was over whelmed with soy sauce. And the CHAUFA tasted like a spoon full of adobo :"( . Unfortunately I would not be returning.

As a Peruvian I did not enjoy the food served here . It has a friendly atmosphere with attentive waitresses but this place is definitely overpriced with small portions. We left hungry and ended up getting tacos from a taco truck. I would recommend going somewhere else.
The vibe was great, small cute spot. Small servings, service was great too. Food was yummy. I recommend!
No comment

This spot right here is absolutely amazing !!!! I can't express enough how much I truly enjoyed the entire experience the food was amazing the drinks were bomb and our server was very attentive. We wanted to ask her for the chef because that's how good the food was. The half chicken was so juicy you could see all the juice dripping off the chicken before eating it .I'll definitely be returning !
No comment

Do not waste your money on this place. Customer service was awful. They were confused when I asked if they had  salchipapa on the menu , I was very surprised because Peruvians love their salchipapa and this place was just not it. Over priced food that is not worth it. Please also save yourself a trip :)  If I could give this 0 stars I would .

Food and service are spot on! Ordered the chaufa mixto  with beef and asparagus and the chicken sandwich and shared the tres leches cake. Aaaaamazing! Flavors are authentic and portions were perfect! For drinks, ordered the pisco sangría and and a sangríta. Both drinks were picture perfect and yummy. The pisco sangría was super refreshing. Let's put it this way the food and drinks were so good I ordered more to take home. Must also recognize the service was wonderful, attentive without being overbearing. We were there for brunch, will definitely be back for dinner.
Chicken stir fried rice was sooo good and the corn off the cob  Brie the bartender and server was so nice and the drinks were good and strong!!! Will be back very soon
Wow- it was totally worth the trip from the city! I finally got to have GOOD Peruvian food here- Lomo Saltado was so delicious, so as ceviche mixto.

This was a pretty chill spot to catch up with friends and have a few drinks. Food is also really good, I ordered a Passion Fruit Margarita, Anticuchos and fries. Music was bumpin and Jackie was really friendly. Although the place can get busy, it was worth the wait. I live pretty far from here but I would definitely go back.

So freaking good! As a Peruvian American, I can say the dishes I had were pretty authentic and really good! We have the beef anticuchos(amazing), papa à la huancaina(decent/had better but would still recommend) and lastly the tallarines verde(this usually comes with steak but the breaded chicheen was amazing and surprising sweet). Beside the great food, the waiter was super sweet and the aesthetic is cute. Definitely costs a bit more for the area but worth it, definitely coming back soon.
Good food a little $ but worth it. There pisco is good and they're frozen margs are strong but tasty. I have eaten here twice.
No comment

I came here Sunday because my sister wanted a drink. Got a margarita to go & tried the Sangria. Now im giving this place 1 star based on the chaste bartender. The drink was 10 & change being that I wanted to give him a tip and only had 11$ I used my card. He asked me if I needed a receipt after paying with my cc I told him no. I got change for a 10 & have him $2 cash tip. You know he had the nerve to add an additional tip on my credit card. Smh I have not called my bank yet because I do not want to wait for a replacement card etc. But how does a person add their own tip to a receipt. That's crazy I've never had that done to me before. I was so shocked. I wish I asked for a copy I know it's hRd times but you do not cheat ppl. It is bad for business!
No comment

Love this new spot! I am totally coming back to try more of the menu. The place is so inviting and the decor and murals are so well thought out. The server was very informative and attentive. The entree that we picked was the seafood rice dish, which was delicious and the lomo saltado was PACKED with flavor. The real surprises were the appetizer the beef hearts and ceviche were amazing! Make sure you get the tres leche, it is one of the best I've ever had  Love this little hidden gem.

Amazing Peruvian Food in this beautiful space with incredible art murals and plants / lights inside. Exceptional Pisco selection. Must try Tacu Tacu and Choufa dishes. Family owned and operated and a great addition to the neighborhood. Great job by Chef Kevin Lenis formerly of Llama Inn.
No comment
Amazing foods so good drinks are awesome and the waitresses are super nice and friendly

I wanted to like this place as this area really needs more places to hang out at with great food, drinks and ambiance.  The place looks very cool, kudos on decor. I give this place two stars because there biggest problem is pricing. The food is good but not worth the price. My wife and i ordered steak dishes. Both steaks were tough. I wouldn't mind this if the dish was 1/2 the price. In fact i would have came back if the price was cut in half. I just couldn't get over having this kind of mediocre food at that price. I would prefer to continue going to the the very close by Hispanic restaurants for better flavor, portion and again price tag.

A friend of mine suggested I swing by Cantina 33, she worked with the chef/owner.  My wife and I went for dinner on a Friday, the place had a nice crowd and the bar was full.  We got sat quickly by our friendly server (unfortunately cant remember her name).  The ambiance was warm and welcoming, and you got the sense they were going for modern Peruvian.  The prices were a bit steep but looking at what they were serving it certainly made sense.  The food was incredible and portion sizes were great.  We'll be back for cocktails and appetizers next time!
Food and drinks were delicious. Staff was friendly and helpful when asking about the different menu options. Loved the sangria!! I can't wait to come back!!

I'll give it  1 star.... the lomo saltado $35?! That's crazy high. The rest of the food wasn't bad at all. I don't think I'll come back anytime soon unless they change up the menu. As for the drinks... piña colada was terrible! They don't even have a blender to make frozen drinks tf is that. Hope it improves really....

Ventured out on a Sunday evening to this new neighborhood joint for a quick dinner. This evening getting a table was relatively easy as the place was only about a third of the way packed. I can see this not being the case in the summer time. I had a frozen passion fruit margarita. My friend had a whiskey sour. Both drinks were well made. I ordered the pork tacos and he had pork burritos.  The tacos  were good- though a little on the small side. I do want to note that I did not leave there hungry but if you're used to more food order the burrito. It was definitely a nice size. There is a parking lot next door- though whether it belongs to the restaurant or the neighboring establishment I'm not quite sure. The ambience is very "Mexican Restaraunt" but I love it. I think this will be a great hang out especially in the summer. The prices were reasonable. They except cash and credit. Ill definitely be back. Really enjoyed it.

Was here the other night and food was so yummy! Service was quick and friendly, wold love to comeback. I shaved a star off because the drinks were small for the price. Two sips and I was  almost done with my margarita.

Scene was nice but food was just okay. Drink menu was a little scary so I stuck to my favorite- vodka with cranberry. Yours was the best I've had in the neighborhood but $13 is a little steep for Myrtle Ave. Waitress did not know how must of the items on the menu were prepared or what they were for that matter. She was however very polite. I concur with the other reviewer that the entrees  are not for sharing however I ate less than half of my arroz chaufa and wanted to take the rest home and was told you didn't have any take home containers because you were only opened for two weeks and after my insistence she had it packed and explained that the establishment didn't want to give the impression that it was a take out restaurant, huh?

All the food was delicious, and the seafood was cooked perfectly! The fried seafood was my favorite, a little spicy, crispy, and still so tender.  Next time we will have to try the meats! The pisco sours were yummy, and there were also other interesting cocktails and wines to choose from!! The ambiance was great too, tropical hanging plants and colorful murals make you feel like you've traveled to a different place! Very nice experience :)

The food was very mediocre. I ordered the wings which tasted like they were from KFC, I had higher expectations. Maybe something tasty and unique. It was not that at all. I also order the Chaufa rice which was not all that. We also got the arepita sliders, those were pretty great. And for dessert we had the tres leches cake and the cake itself was extra dense, never had a trea leches cake like that in my life!!! We didn't even finish it, we just left it there. The waitress was so nice and always attentive which was awesome and she was friendly and polite, the drinks were good, I got a classic mojito. However I would not come back but it was not anything special. But the place is beautiful! A cute girls night or date night but the food can we way way better.

Delicious Peruvian cuisine and awesome pisco sours. Definitely recommend the jalea, it is fried to perfection. The decor is amazing in this place and the staff is friendly and attentive. Definitely worth stopping by for dinner or just drinks, you will not be disappointed.

Came in for happy hour(5-8pm) on a Saturday and I had such a great time here! Pisco cocktail was $8 and it was perfectly made! The Chicken Chaufa($18) was soooo delicious and the flan was bomb! I would've went for the Lomo but it was $35; appetizers are $10 and over. So it is on the expensive side.

Today was my second time coming here the first time was amazing although today was such disappointment the food is amazing that's why I came back I order bottles mimosas and it's from 2 to 4 it was 3:45 and the waitres told me the bottomless finishes a 4 and I was like ok its 3:45 she said the owner says is over we were very disappointed since we came just for brunch ‍

Went in with my Girlfriend to eat some Peruvian style food and have a drink or two. We was greeted as soon as we entered the restaurant by both bartender and waiter and was given traditional Cancha Corn. We ordered Papa A La Huancaina as an appetizer and a steak with papa and it was very delicious and well presented and cooked, that you dont even need a steak knife to cut the steak. The seasoning is like no other place, unique flavors that leaves you wanting more. The only problem I had was the drink I ordered was a Whiskey Sour, the bartender over poured more sour/bitter making you not really taste the whiskey. The Chef/Owner would come out and present himself, we was honored on meeting the owner and chef of Cantina 33. Would recommend to friends and family to go eat and drink their. Had a fun night and planning to go back and try more food from their menu.

Chef Kevin really nailed the Peruvian flavors in his dishes. Food is phenomenal greatly presented and well portioned! Can't wait to go back for the limo saltado! The drinks are also amazing! Everything is just right!

Really yummy! Food came fast and everything was super flavorful. One of our fav meals of quarantine. Its been hard to get excited during these times but this meal really lifted our spirits. Excited to go when we are able to dine in :)
favourite new neighborhood spot. Friendly atmosphere, impeccable drinks and a drinks and food menu with a really thoughtful connection to Peru. Best drinks and vibes in the area by far.

The place has great artwork on the right side. But, the food over here is just mediocre. Unfortunately, the dishes were overly priced with food of really small portions. The waiter told us the portions were big. The Chicha morada, I was expecting high quality chicha morada similar to what I had in Peru. It was a difference of day and night.. it was like drinking pure tap. If you're not too hungry for the night, this might be it. If you're hungry, I would recommend elsewhere

Dope decor food is excellent and cocktails are delicious! Awesome vibe that me and my friend walked in on randomly! A huge welcome to the neighborhood and is a must check out for great new places to dine or just have a casual drink!!

Wow my husband and I had such a delicious dinner the duck was so tender and the fried fish entree was light and crispy. But damn those prices lol we wish this place was just a little more affordable so we could come eat more often.. we will definitely be back for a cocktail tho. Service was great

Happened to stop by Cantina 33 on their grand opening and was blown away by every detail of this restaurant! Since then, I've been back several times, I just can't get enough of it! The ambience is stellar, the service is quality, and the food/drinks are to die for! When you stop by, make sure to try some of the pisco punch with some ceviche, you won't regret it! Thank you to everyone who works at Cantina 33 for making me feel welcome, answering any questions I had, and creating a wonderful haven of delicious food and great vibes.
Must try Beef Heart and Lomo.. great flavor .. so yummy .. over all great atmosphere .. love the art work on the wall .. drinks and food great !!

My fiancee and I went to eat here on a whim for brunch and absolutely loved it! We had the Chaufa (Peruvian stir fried rice) and was absolutely delicious! Best fried rice I've ever had in my life. You can have it with either chicken, beef, asparagus or shrimp. If you dont want to decide on one you can mix two of them up, we chose asparagus and beef and could not be any happier we did that. We also had the crispy chicken sandwich with the fries which was also absolutely amazing. Chicken was tender on the inside, perfectly crispy on the outside and the fries were stupendous. The drinks were also on point. We had the frozen sangrita and the pisco sangria and they were delicious! For dessert we shared the dulce de tres leche and it was also really good. The service was great! They checked up on us and made sure we were doing ok. Food came out quickly, it was a great experience overall. We are definitely going back for more delicious food but you don't have to take my word for it definitely check it out for yourself and be the judge. I'll just end it with this, I'm a foodie and am rarely wrong when it comes to food

thank you thank you thank you. exactly what i needed in the neighborhood. the food was AMAZING and right next to my gym! had the ceviche, and lomo saltado. delicious!!!! and the aesthetic OH MY GOD need I say more? the bartender, Destiny, made some slammin drinks and even came up to us to make sure they were good. after some laughs with her, our server Juanquin joined into the convo. such a sweet guy! can't wait to go back!!!  congrats and wishin you guys so much success!!!!

Truly a hidden gem! Not one to venture down to tribeca for dinner but would definitely go back for The Greek. They did everything right - service was top tier, drinks were great and food was even better. Everything came out in a timely manner and was so delicious. The table split dips and I can confirm we all had to fight for the last bite. Each dip so unique and packed with flavor we were left wanting more. For my main, I got the Santorini salad with grilled chicken and this is what hit home for me. I've never had such a well balanced, salad with chicken this good. The others got the octopus entree and Greek salads. All of us were extremely satisfied. Not to mention it's not overly priced for the quality of food you're getting and the ambiance. You have to go here if you haven't been already.
No comment

A surprise! It's felt a little bit chainish when I walked in but I was pleasantly surprised. We actually came to The Greek Tribeca after another restaurant where we have a reservation actually had some maintenance issue. This was within walking distance and we went for it. First off, the space is HUGE. It is a very large and very roomy and very nice space. It is ideal for a meeting or a quiet time with friends. We went during brunch time and the service was just right. The service staff were amazing. The fifth star is for them. The food was actually very good. I have been trying to eat a lot more whole. I know. Laughable. Me eating healthier! But! It wasn't hard here. I had a soup and pita and the egg scramble bowl. The eggs were actually amazing. With a feta crumble, avocado and tomato. It was very filling and I knew I was getting my macros! I also had the chicken avgolemono soup and it was also good. It could have done with a bit more lemon but it did the trick.

Get me to the Greek! Everything we ordered was excellent. The dips and pita were awesome. Delicious fresh pita. The grape leaves were amazing. The meatballs we inhaled. The chicken souvlaki was great. Been to Greece a bunch for work and this food is legit. I am a huge fan.

I think they call it the Greek, because they have a few Greek dishes added to their menu. But as far as authenticity and taste, it's far from Greek. The tzatziki sauce is pure dill taste (didn't expect that) and they had a Gyro on the menu, which was of Mushrooms (not lamb). The chicken Slovaki chicken chunks were seasoned with cayenne pepper, and the rice was turmeric rice. It's was aight. Nothing to brag about. Everything I ate tasted fresh and amazing. The complimentary dips were fresh, homemade and fantastic.  The lemon potatoes and grilled octopus with bacon were to die for.  I also really appreciated the extensive Greek wine list.  Two of my favorites were on the list.  And lastly I loved the Greek spin on the halva.  It was served to perfection with the Greek coffee.

Came here for lunch with a friend and loved it. We split the large meat sampler platter, which the waitress claimed was going to be too much, but it wasn't. With the exception of the chicken skewers, all the meats on the platter were fantastic! I particularly liked the beef burger and the sausage (surprisingly). And of course, the lamb chops on there were prepared so well it just fell off the bone--amazing. The beef burger was stuffed with cheese so it was extra aromatic. The salad it came with was very refreshing and they were super generous with their homemade chips. Friend and I swore we wouldn't eat them, but they were too good to pass up. Definitely stop by here for lunch! Cute place with lots of variety in seating options and because it is in Tribeca, it's never insanely crowded and never has a wait. My only complaints would be that the waitresses didn't seem to know what was going on much and the AC is cranked up way too high in here. I was freezing.

This is Greece, in America!  The food is so flavorful, the décor is right out of Greece, the music is as relaxing as it gets.  Our waitress was attentive, fast, and anticipated what we would want before we thought of it.  I love this place and will make it a regular dining locale.

After cocktails at Maco, we took our girls night to The Greek--which did not disappoint!  The atmosphere of the restaurant was welcoming, and made us feel like we were truly in Greece.  Unlike many restaurants in New York, I could actually see and hear my girlfriends while we ate, which made our experience that much more pleasant.  We knew we were in for a treat when the complimentary pita and hummus were delicious.  If a restaurant takes that much care with standard nibbles, their actual food is usually ten times better!  We ordered the fried feta cheese for an appetizer, which our waiter served with a drizzle of honey.  It.  was. incredible.  I ordered the scallops with pomegranates, which was light and deliciously flavorful.  I tried a bit of one of my friends moussaka, which was beautifully seasoned and prepared.  I did not try our other friend's Cornish hen, but she raved about it.  Our waiter must have read my mind when I mentioned wanting dessert (my companions were too full), because The Greek serves each guest a mini bar of chocolate along with the check.  What a perfect end to a lovely meal.

This place is awesome!! I only had appetizers and drinks but both were amazing. The Manhattan here is so well done, I love it. We tried almost all apps, and they were all so delicious and yummy. Would totally recommend and will certainly be back. Plus, the ambiance here was absolutely gorgeous and the people here were so nice and friendly.

Wanted to love this place but they screw you at the bar service. We ordered the medium krya plate and were not given enough bread to finish the dips.  When I asked for more bread the server (demetri) told me he didn't want me to sit and order bread all night w my $20 appetizer among other things. Food was decent but someone must be impressed w their Michelin recommendation because I wasn't.  Terrible service from him a they gave up 2 stars for that.  The Hostess was delightful.

So pleasantly surprised at how beautiful this place was. The decor and lighting is just so inviting. Staff is professional and attentive. Food is inventive and new. Nice way to start a night in the city. Check the dips out they're not to be missed.

I ate at the Greek last night with my partner. Saturday night. Had been there before and love the decor and delicious food, particularly the small plates. However, I will not go again on Saturday night. It was so loud that my partner and I could not talk to each other. We asked to give us the rest of dinner to go and left. Tables are too close to each other, impossible to have a private conversation. They tried to squeeze as many tables as possible in a small space. Again, amazing food but poor dining experience.
This place was great. Wonderful service, delicious food, beautiful ambience. I'd agree with the other reviewers that it should be classified as $$$ instead of $$ but it's totally worth it.
The freshness and quality of food at this place makes it a must check out restaurant in NY. Great vibe and really buzzy so will definitely be back.
just discovered this neighborhood gem and I'll be back. the staff are friendly and aren't afraid to make recommendations. The dips to start and the shrimp were amazing!!!

Came for dinner late on a Sunday evening, no reservations-the restaurant was off the beaten path and very charming. We started of with some Greek wine - The Santorini white was a phenomenal recommendation. For our appetizers we had the horiatiki salata, 4 traditional spreads, and octopus -all great!! For our main entrees we had the lamb chops, *cooked perfectly*, and the whole Red Snapper. AWESOME FIND! The entire experience was amazing, We felt very taken care of. THANK YOU!

Great food.  Great wine-list.  Owner & somm helped pick out two standout wines for the price (~$100 average, which I felt would be on a NYC wine-list elsewhere for $120-160).  When we had issues with one wine being potentially oxidized, they quickly swapped it out for a fresh bottle.

The best dinner I've had in a while! Their dessert was amazing too - so far, I've tried the feta cheesecake and the bourekia, and both were incredible! The Greek salad had the best veggies - I didn't even know produce of this quality existed in NYC. The fried feta with honey was decadent!

I always stop here for lunch after workout  at Superstar gym. They also have healthy choices. Good cozy place with good service. It is more neighborhood place you can enjoy your food without tourist crowd.

Had a wonderful dinner celebrating wife's birthday. Warm service without any affect, delicious mezze dips  and warm, home made grape leaves for starters. Mediterranean sea bass filets over lentils was a big hit for main, and a surprise gratis cheesecake, more savory than sweet was a great finish. Hospitality is the name of the game and you can find it at the Greek. Three $ signs is more like it, but it is Manhattan and nothing is skimped on.
Just about the best Greek food I've eaten in this country. Octopus, salads, lentils, mixed grill, Retsina. Every single item was perfect.

Appetizers were great. Entrees were bit disappointing though. I don't usually eat lamb, but it was actually quite good at this place. Overall the food was bit salty for us. Nice atmosphere and decor. Our waiter was awesome.

I like the Greek but I went Thursday night with another couple and we ordered 4 entrees and 30 minutes later the waiter came back to tell us that they ran out of all of them.   We ended up eating entrees we really didn't want and it turned out to be a challenging experience.  They did comp us on 3 of the 4 entrees but the experience was pretty weak.  We have been there before and have liked it but this was pretty out of bounds.  If you go please ask the waiter to make sure they have what you are ordering so this does not happen to you.
Best lamb chops that I ever had.  I don't think I've ever had Greek wine but it paired perfectly with the lamb.

We love The Greek TriBeCa! The atmosphere is cozy Greek and TriBeCa cool...it takes you back to rustic Thessaloniki. The owner and staff make sure to take care of you as if you are a regular.  The appetizers are authentic and well executed: the tomatoes in the salad are sweet and tasty like you cannot imagine in the US, the spreads are delicate yet flavorful, the cheese and spinach pies are like a Greek Yiayia's (grandma). Everything on the grill is properly done from the fish to the steak to the outstanding lamb chops. And to finish, try the creative feta cheesecake; not your typical Greek dessert or your typical NYC cheesecake, but the epitome of the fusion of both.

We had a wonderful evening out with my bf. I am greek and he is not. I can appreciate the good food and we loved the Cretan Lyra and the live music. Kind people wonderful crowd. The ouzo was perfect the mixed grill amazing, the cheese and spinach pie like I make them and my bf was so happy! Thank you people of "the Greek" for the 5 star experience!

We went two nights in a row- seriously! The signature cocktail is made with the spiced honey syrup they use in the baklava and it's deelish. The food is divine. Lamb shank like rich, moist and falling off the bone. I had grilled octopus and beet salad. Both were fresh and very tasty. Lovely staff.

In the past three months I have lived in the Greater New York City Area there is no doubt this is the best restaurant I have been to in NYC. Be prepared for a long wait on a Friday night, but it will be worth it.
Loved the service and the owner was very hospitable. Good job guys, keep it up!

The Greek has the most authentic greek food I have ever tasted. Not only is the ambiance and design beyond anything I have ever witnessed, the food is delightful. Even the basic Beet salad is to die for. I have never been to Greece but I would imagine that this is exactly what the food tastes like. The desserts are also perfect. It was really an experience. This place is amazing. First of all, its beautiful - warm and elegant and rustic. The food is amazing. They give you delish mezze type dips when you sit down, toasted fluffy pita. The food was perfect - authentic but not too greasy or garlicky, as some greek food can be. I will be coming back often... a great neighborhood spot and 100% worth a visit

I walked by the Greek while in town and decided to try it for lunch.  It's as if I was home, eating at my mother or pethera's house.   This is Greek cooking at its finest - simple, fresh, and authentic; it's the first time I've seen tsai vounou on the menu in the states, which was perfect on a cold day.  Can't wait to return.
Great cocktails and wine recommendation to start; fresh and delicious Greek salad; the octopus appetizer and pork shank entree were both excellent. Outstanding service, very comfortable and clean.

Went for lunch on my last day in Tribeca before returning to Chicago.  What a glorious experience.  The Greek salad (ripe tomatoes, cucumber, feta and arugula) was fantastic, the artichoke with fennel and bechamel, fabulous, the octapodi...stupendi and the pork belly with orzo utterly delicious.  The ambiance was beautifully Mediterranean and the music very soulful.  Tom was especially helpful in setting the stage for a wonderful dining experience.  Thank you for such a wonderful summer afternoon meal!

Incredible food. Everything is on the menu is on point.  From the salads to the meats to the dips.  EVERYTHING is good.  The service is excellent and the drinks are strong!  This is a great spot to meet friends and pig out.

This restaurant hits all the good spots. The food is delicious; the service is impeccable. The prices are somewhat higher than what they should be, but the overall dining experience is great.  The flava beans are phenomenal. So is the lavraki fish. The waiters are knowledgeable about Greek wine and offer options which may make you reevaluate your opinion of Greek wine. Try the Vinsanto dessert wine.

This place is like one of your favorite record albums where you love every song because they hit it out of the ball park.  Every single dish we had here was terrific and some were sublime. Starting out with the spread, the crisp bread was perfect with the best tzatsiki sauce we have ever had. The salad was quite possibly the best Greek salad as well; the feta cheese was perfect and it was all fresh and crisp. We also enjoyed the mixed grill and the highlight was the lamb chops which were sublime. The artichoke moussaka really transcended any moussaka we have ever had. We also enjoyed the lamb guvetsi and the octupus and the chicken dish. We had a party of 6 and our delight in the dining experience was unanimous. Every plate was finished clean. The desserts were lovely as well; we enjoyed the feta cheesecake, baklava and chocolate cake. The service was fantastic and the waiter really selected everything for us and clearly succeeded in making a great impression. No trip to NY can occur without coming here for a meal for me in the future!

Just had a surprise birthday dinner here and the owner and everyone there were so accommodating and wonderful. The surprise was executed perfectly. The food and wine were great too. The pancetta entree was amazing. Everyone at the table also tried the octopadi appetizer and loved it. Everyone also kept saying how pretty the restaurant was and asking me how I came to find it. Definitely a gem tucked away in Tribeca.
Beautiful.  Love this place.  Exactly what a restaurant should be.  Great food, atmosphere.  Go now.

What an absolute gem. Fantastic service, absolutely delicious food, and decent prices (considering the rest of the neighborhood). The warm bread and hummus served first is your first sign the food's going to be amazing. I had the Greek coffee, which was some of the best coffee I've ever had. I had the cheese-stuffed pepper and the Greek salad, which were great. The space is really cozy and beautifully decorated. I can't wait to go back here.

I was in the city and wanted Greek food and my boyfriend and I came here and it was such a great choice. I loved it the mood the food and the service. If you would good feel comfort food this is the spot I recommend this place hands down. Just the drive was bad to come in the city but great
The food here is great. One of the tastiest salads and hand cut real CHIPS not pathetic fries. All they need now is Taramasalata and I will be in heaven

Everything about our evening was wonderful. We had reservations and arrived early, party of five, the manager made us feel welcome and genuinely glad to see us, what a nice concept!  The Greek is cozy and feels warm and welcoming. What an extensive menu and we relied on our waiter Dimitrios to guide us in selections based on our wines which were very good. Our table ordered a variety of plates to all share so we could try many things. The standouts were the baby octopus (amazing smoky and grilled flavor, best ever), scallops were perfectly seasoned and tender, stuffed eggplant was delicious, lima beans were flavored with the most amazing herbs. The desserts change frequently, we shared two desserts a feta cheesecake with a fig glaze topping and this was the best cheesecake we have ever had. The wait staff and manager were friendly and helpful, all with a lively fun atmosphere and music. Our group of friends kept discussing this meal for days and I would highly recommend going, we will again on our next trip to NYC.

We visited the Kyuramen in Chinatown last night. We walked in but It was about an hour wait for a table so we were able to get a seat at the bar. The menu is pretty self explanatory. We tried the Fried Oysters, the MEGA Ramen which was okay. We also tried the Chicken Ramen which was also good, the chicken was not dry. The Oysters were the selling point! Not many non-pork options or more seafood options. Majority of the menu was pork. We also tried Thai Tea which was okay nothing too fancy. We would go back but it would not be a regular ramen spot. Not bad, just not worth waiting more than 15 minutes for a table.

I espcially love their popcorn chicken, purple sweet potato fries and takoyaki. If you're a fan of Thai iced tea, the one at kyuramen is so good!  Highly recommend checking them out :)
This place is super cute and the food is delicious. I came in a group of 4 and they sat us quickly. I would definitely come again!
Came here twice with friends and date. Super cute ambience and the service was good. Omurice 10/10! Karaage chicken was really crispy and flavorful too.
The decor is very stylish and very well put together. The food is decent. The fried oyster is a little on the filling side.

Service was excellent! The kimchi ramen #15 was delicious especially with the combo, the bao was great! Definitely going back!

And finally the ramen. This is why my 3 stars bc its a ramen spot and the ramen wasn't 5* worth. Missing something the broth was way too sweet missing salt and something else as well. We had the number1 and number2 ramen. The desert was delicious we had the mango mille crepe cake. Anyways I wouldn't go back for the ramen but if im ever around and want some finger picking food then it will do.

I feel like it's my duty to balance out the 4.8 star rating on Google and Yelp. For this price point, there are better ramen options in the city for food taste/quality (eg. menkoi sato, ichiran, toribro), but the vibe/ambiance here is more modern/trendy (if you're more interested in that than just food); definitely some cute seating! I sat at the bar which was spacious and nice for a party of 1. I ordered combo A (white garlic shoyu ramen) and found the noodles to be overcooked and the broth to be average (no special character/body); chasu was tender but nothing special. I also ordered fried oysters as an app and thought they were a great app, but they weren't a must-try item. I saved the bao to eat later (didn't really need it but it's the same price to order the pudding and ramen so thought i'd order the set since it's a better value). I'm glad I tried the matcha pudding, but note that it's small/personal-sized and it's definitely not concentrated with high quality matcha. If you want the latter, get a soft serve from the place attached T the front! Service was good until the end - had to wait more than 10 min for my card to be run, but the staff was really friendly. Overall, I think this is a decent spot for the neighborhood but don't expect it to blow your mind.

The pistachio pesto added a niche crunch to the crudo. The chicken was like a remake of Korean Fried Chicken - supposedly coated in honey butter sauce but somehow the saltiness was a little too overpowering. For the larger plates we tried Nduja Mussels and shrimp risotto. The shrimps were really fresh and I personally like the added texture of the onions and scallions to the creamy risotto. However, the flavor was a bit one-note - I couldn't taste much except salty and a hint of spice from the chili. Thai milk cake was what caught my attention in the first place so absolutely had to get it. The concept of this cake sounds really fun - a tres leches with an Asian twist. The Thai milk tea sauce was no doubt the highlight, only wished there was more to soak both layers of sponge cake. The whipped cream and mango weirdly did not taste much so we basically ignored the toppings and ate the cake dipped in delicious Thai tea.

The chill vibes, decor, and bar area set the stage for a relaxing experience and a true escape from the hustle and bustle of the NYC streets (that we love, but need a break from sometimes). The music and sound is loud enough but not so loud that you can't have a good conversation. The food is gorgeous to look at (especially the fluke appetizer!) and so delicious.
